pr_title: Added content response on write enabled feature to Gateway and Direct TCP

timeline.message: Added return minimal response feature to Gateway and Direct TCP for item write operations

timeline.bodyText: ChangeFeedProcessor is a read-only, how minimal response impacts it?
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText: This is SampleChangeFeedProcessor example, which creates some documents before listening to them, so used it. This is not in the source code.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.author: kirankumarkolli
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -163,6 +166,20 @@ CosmosKeyCredential cosmosKeyCredential() {
         return cosmosKeyCredential;
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Gets the boolean which indicates whether to only return the headers and status code in Cosmos DB response
+     * in case of Create, Update and Delete operations on CosmosItem.
+     *
+     * If true, this removes the resource from response. It reduces networking
+     * and CPU load by not sending the resource back over the network and serializing it
+     * on the client.
+     *
+     * @return a boolean indicating whether resource will be included in the response or not
+     */
+    boolean isReturnMinimalResponse() {

replies.bodyText: NoContentResponseOnWrite was the current full name .NET using.
replies.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText: Will go with noContentResponseOnWrite as the new name. Thanks.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: for similar configs we have "Enabled" as the suffix. To be consistent please add "Enabled" at the end. (noContentResponseOnWriteEnabled)
replies.author: moderakh

timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText:
Unknown scenarios, but this already exists in the SDK, and there is a unit test as well. Didn't want to break that.
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/pull/10741/files#diff-7011a46947ace6e46648f8c4027e602eL414
So to keep the functionality intact, I am re-using the logic we already have.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: I am thinking if this is not exposed through public api, we should drop the generic support and only have support for minimalResponseContent scenario
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: I like that idea @moderakh . I will get rid of it.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
given that currently the only preferred header is minimal response, I wonder if we can avoid string concatination here:
instead of
preferHeaderName + "=" + preferHeaderValue
we just pass minimanRespose=true
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
This doesn't get called. The other overload gets called :)
But since the only preferred header is minimalResponse, I will remove this overload.
Also, just to clarify, it is passed as: prefer:return=minimal :)
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
we usually target emulator for database and container CRUD test, because otherwise we may run out of master resource budget in prod.
can we target emulator here too? that will help in ensuring less random test failure due to master budget throttling
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Yes, makes sense, will do that.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.message:
Updated name to noContentResponseOnWrite.
Updated cosmos container and database tests to emulator groups.
Removed prefer header generic logic

timeline.bodyText: NIT: I think pretty much all customers identifying this setting will also ask themselves whether this flag will have impact on RU charges. Would be good to document that it doesn't (at least my understanding) here - or at least in the FAQ for the feature.
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -291,6 +292,39 @@ public CosmosClientBuilder keyCredential(CosmosKeyCredential cosmosKeyCredential
         return this;
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Gets the boolean which indicates whether to only return the headers and status code in Cosmos DB response
+     * in case of Create, Update and Delete operations on CosmosItem.
+     *
+     * If true, this removes the resource from response. It reduces networking
+     * and CPU load by not sending the resource back over the network and serializing it
+     * on the client.
+     *
+     * By-default, this is true.
+     *
+     * @return a boolean indicating whether resource will be included in the response or not
+     */
+    boolean isNoContentResponseOnWrite() {
+        return noContentResponseOnWrite;
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Sets the boolean to only return the headers and status code in Cosmos DB response
+     * in case of Create, Update and Delete operations on CosmosItem.
+     *
+     * If set to true, this removes the resource from response. It reduces networking
+     * and CPU load by not sending the resource back over the network and serializing it on the client.

replies.bodyText: I like that idea, will document that "this doesn't impact RU usage for read or write operations"
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
For other similar configs we are using the Enabled suffix
isSessionCapturingOverrideEnabled
isConnectionReuseAcrossClientsEnabled
should we change this to isNoContentResponseOnWriteEnabled to be consistent with the other APIs?
timeline.author: moderakh
timeline.diffHunk:

+     *
+     * By-default, this is true.
+     *

replies.bodyText:
Yes, makes sense to be consistent across these APIs, good catch @moderakh
I will update this public surface API to reflect that.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

should we change this to noContentResponseOnWriteEnabled to be consistent with the other APIs?

replies.bodyText:
This will differ from what we have on .Net side.
@kirankumarkolli  - what do you think ?
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.author: David-Noble-at-work

timeline.bodyText: Thanks for removing this. I was showing some code to a customer and noticed these very old comments were still present.
timeline.author: David-Noble-at-work
David-Noble-at-work
David-Noble-at-work

timeline.message: Finalized name and updated documentation regarding RU usage
Fixed benchmark configurations, internal TestSuiteBase async document clients with content response on write flag
Fixed more tests by enabling content on response. Updated names of tests to reflect correct value
Fixed negation check of content response flag on write throughput and write latency
Fixed more tests client builders with content response on write disabled
